description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) for removal of condition 7 (New Dwellings - HMO Use) of planning permission ref: 241475FUL dated 07/08/2024 for: Conversion of single dwellinghouse to two flats; Single storey ground floor wrap-around extension and first-floor side extension; Rear roof extension. Amendment seeks removal of restrictions to convert from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Existing Drawings Location and Block Plan, Project No. 2228, Sheet E00, received 6 August 2024; Existing Drawings Floor Plans, Project No. 2228, Sheet E01, received 6 August 2024; Existing Drawings Elevations, Project No. 2228, Sheet E02, received 6 August 2024; Existing Drawings Section, Project No. 2228, Sheet E03, received 6 August 2024; Existing Drawings Details, Project No. 2228, Sheet E04, received 6 August 2024; Proposed Drawings Floor Plans, Project No. 2228, Sheet P01, received 6 August 2024; Proposed Drawings Floor Plans, Project No. 2228, Sheet P02, received 6 August 2023; Proposed Drawings Elevations, Project No. 2228, Sheet P03, received 6 August 2024; Proposed Drawings Section, Project No. 2228, Sheet P04, received 6 August 2024; Proposed Drawings Details, Project No. 2228, Sheet P05, received 6 August 2024; Proposed Drawings Details, Project No. 2228, Sheet P06, received 6 August 2024; Proposed Drawings Hardscapes, Project No. 2228, Sheet P07, received 6 August 2024; Proposed Drawings Softscapes, Project No. 2228, Sheet P08, received 6 August 2024; Supporting Statement dated 04/12/2024

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy(2012). | Cycle storage for 4 bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with the designated locations identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and all adopted standards prior to the first occupation of the building. The storage spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the designated location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, further details of the hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. All detailed works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the premises. Such details shall include: the height and materials of the boundary treatment, the provision of planting in the forecourt and any new surfacing materials to be used.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D8, G4 and G5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024) | Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, unless the Local Planning Authority first gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies D3, D4, D8, G3, G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).
